manual.title: User Manual
manual.header1: This guide helps you navigate the app and make the most of its features.
manual.header2: Browse the sections to learn how to interact with Tasks, Users, and the interface.
manual.model1: Each Task can be assigned to a User.
manual.model2: Available Task statuses: TODO, IN PROGRESS, PAUSED, DONE.
manual.model4.1: To move to IN PROGRESS, the Task must have an ACTIVE assignee.
manual.model4.2: To move to DONE, the assignee must still be ACTIVE.
manual.model4.3: If a User is blocked, all their IN PROGRESS Tasks are set to PAUSED.
manual.model4.4: Deleting a User will unlink their Tasks and set any IN PROGRESS ones to PAUSED.
manual.navbar1: Access the main views: Dashboard, Tasks, and Users.
manual.navbar2: Open the manual or view author information.
manual.navbar3: Choose from three available visual themes.
manual.dashboard1: Users are shown on the left, Tasks on the right, grouped by assignee.
manual.dashboard2: Icon colors indicate the current status of each item.
manual.dashboard3: Colored lines connect Tasks to their assigned Users.
manual.dashboard4: Use the buttons at the top right to open or reset filters.
manual.dashboard5: Unassigned Tasks can be shown at the top, bottom, or hidden entirely.
manual.dashboard7: Click on a Task or User to open it in edit mode.
manual.management1: Use the top-left button to create a new Task or User.
manual.management2: Use the controls on the right to open or reset filters.
manual.management4: Each row includes buttons for editing, progressing (Task only), and deleting.
manual.management5: Saving and progression are disabled if the rules are not met.
author.title: Alessandro De Prato
author.line1: I’m a curious and versatile fullstack developer, constantly exploring innovative technologies. I love to learn independently, experimenting with new solutions by building complete and polished projects where every detail matters.
author.line2: I enjoy crafting interfaces that are user-centered, supported by solid architecture and thoughtful design. Behind every feature lies a drive to combine performance, clean code, and modularity. I believe in continuous refactoring and scalability as engines of innovation — it’s not just about making things work, but about making them work well, today and tomorrow.
author.line3: With this project, I wanted to prove that even a ToDo app can have soul: precision in every detail, thoughtful choices, and a touch of character.
